item.title: Blowfish + UD: Build your own Web3 Blog
item.description:
Introduction
#

In the era of Web3, owning your content means more than just writing it — it means truly controlling where and how it lives. By combining the Blowfish theme (a beautiful, modern Hugo theme) with Unstoppable Domains (UD) and IPFS, you can create a fully decentralized, censorship-resistant blog that’s as easy to update as a traditional site — but lives forever on the blockchain.

item.title: Demystifying IFEO: Launching Processes Without Infinite Debugger Loops
item.description: Image File Execution Options (IFEO) is a powerful Windows registry feature for debugging, but it often leads to headaches—like infinite loops when your process tries to launch an IFEO-configured executable. You’ve probably seen advice to use DEBUG_PROCESS flags and detach immediately, but that requires messy debug code.

item.title: Traversing Windows Loader Structures: Enumerating DLLs & Console Processes
item.description:
Sometimes, the most powerful tools are the ones you build yourself.

Today, I’m sharing a minimal, self-contained C program that demonstrates how to walk the Windows NT Loader’s in-memory module lists and extract loaded DLLs — without using EnumProcessModules or CreateToolhelp32Snapshot.
